headshotImage.caption: Dasun Shanaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dasun Shanaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy lbw b Shanaka 20 (41b 0x4 0x6 48m) SR: 48.78

dismissalComment.html: The captain breaks the stand! Huge appeal for leg before, Dasun is pleading but the umpire is unmoved. He goes for the review! This was full and swinging in. Hridoy charges down the track and is rapped on the front pad just below the knee roll as he looks to work it onside. It looked like impact could be outside the line, but the replays say otherwise! Outstanding review from the Lankan skipper! Three reds and the dangerous Hridoy is gone.

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalComment.html: youngster removes veteran! And Kusal Mendis has held on to a stunner too. Short ball outside off but with regulation bounce. Shakib tries to cut but ends up gloving it even before he played the shot. Keeper dives to his left and sticks the left-hand out. Then brings out a wide smile as if to say that's clean. TV umpire confirms it. Shakib clearly deceived by the extra pace, being hit on the hand even before he got the bat down for the shot

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: Uppercut straight to third man! This was a bouncer outside off and Mushfiqur is looking for a six but doesn't get enough on it. The man in the deep doesn't need to move much as he pouches this comfortably

headshotImage.caption: Taskin Ahmed headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Taskin Ahmed headshot

dismissalComment.html: third for Pathirana, Bangladesh nine down. Good length ball around off. Pokes at it, gets a chip to cover

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and that's all over, Bangladesh 164 all out. Pathirana gets a slower ball to hiss through and leave Mustafizur Rahman stunned into submission. Lands on middle and leg and hits the pad with him offering almost no shot. Bangladesh review but that's a mere formality. Sri Lanka need 165 to win.

dismissalComment.html: hits him on the back foot, terrific delivery! Full ball originating on a leg-stump line, but the ball drifts across towards middle and off, and hits the back leg after Tanzid missed the defensive prod. A duck on debut, never a sight we like to see, but that was indeed a beautiful ball.

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz run out (de Silva/Rajitha) 5 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: length ball angling in, and clipped to square leg. Shanto has taken off for a run but Miraz does not move. Rajitha collects the throw and takes the bails off. Now the question is - is Shanto out or Miraz? Confirmed it is Miraz because Shanto had run across to the other end, even going past the crease, while Miraz was out of his crease.

videos.summary: There was confusion as to which batter was out before the third umpire give his decision

commentTextItems.html: finishes it with a four - Sri Lanka cruise to a five-wicket win! Length ball pulled behind square and beats the fielder in the deep. Asalanka with the pleasure of the winning runs and also remaining not out.

commentPostTextItems.html: Enjoy the live show, because that's the end of our text coverage today. On behalf of the rest of our team, a big thank you to ya'll for joining us. See you day after tomorrow for more Asia Cup action!

Matheesha Pathirana is the POTM: "(Feeling of getting POTM in an ODI) This is my first man of the match title for my country, so really happy about it. (T20 skills in ODIs) Slower balls are important, that's why I took wickets in the death. Useful skill from T20s to fifty overs. My bowling is different so a little unpredictable."

Dasun Shanaka, the winning captain: "We thought it was a better pitch than the score Bangladesh scored. The bowlers stood up. (Wickets) The wickets are being used in the LPL so we all know.... (Sadeera and Asalanka) Tricky surface. Sadeera, the way he fielded, it was his day. Asalanka is good signs for Sri Lanka cricket."
10.02pm We'll hear from the winning captain and Player of the Match shortly.

Shakib Al Hasan, losing captain: (Not enough runs?) Yes, it was not a 300 wicket, but we needed 220-230 runs to make a game. (Responsibility of his batting with no Tamim and Litton) Yes more responsibility, I couldn't do it, but as a batting effort we didn't do well. We have a big game coming up. (Captaincy in bowling effort) When they are 30 down for 3, we knew we needed a couple of more wickets, but unfortunately we didn't get that. Bowlers and spinners have been doing their bit for a long time now, just not enough runs on the board. (Positives for crunch games) There are lot of nerves when we started the game but as we kept on batting, in the 20th over, we felt lot more comfortable. This is the first time playing Asia Cup and in away conditions."

Sadeera Samarawickrama: (Came in at a difficult situation) We were two wickets down early so my plan was to bat positive but also continue my batting because we needed partnerships. (Conditions) Batting was not easy on this wicket - we saw for both teams. Spinning and bit slow to fast bowlers but I just backed myself. That's it. (Driving off the front foot and pull shots) I have always backed my strength, that's my strength in batting. I work hard for that, so any situation I back these shots."

9.51pm This is the 11th consecutive win for Sri Lanka in ODIs. A convincing win for Sri Lanka sets them atop Group B, the group of death, while Bangladesh know that their game against Afghanistan on Sunday is now a must-win. A game played in good spirits, no dance moves displayed on the field atleast.

The positives for Bangladesh were Shanto's well-built innings and their fielding effort. Otherwise, Sri Lanka were too hot on the day, and also showed their bowling bench strength is very strong too. Pathirana's four-for led their bowling effort, but Theekshana, de Silva and Wellalage were great too. And then, despite an early hiccup, Sri Lanka rebuild on the back of a strong partnership from Samarawickrama and Asalanka. Both batters finished with half-centuries, a confidence booster ahead of their next game on Tuesday against Afghanistan.

But Bangladesh review - why not, nothing to lose Replay shows it thudded into the pad. NO BAT! So ball tracking now.... and its "umpire's call" on height, just clipping top of middle. Shanaka survives, Bangladesh keep the review.

dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy lbw b Shanaka 20 (41b 0x4 0x6 48m) SR: 48.78

dismissalComment.html: The captain breaks the stand! Huge appeal for leg before, Dasun is pleading but the umpire is unmoved. He goes for the review! This was full and swinging in. Hridoy charges down the track and is rapped on the front pad just below the knee roll as he looks to work it onside. It looked like impact could be outside the line, but the replays say otherwise! Outstanding review from the Lankan skipper! Three reds and the dangerous Hridoy is gone.

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz run out (de Silva/Rajitha) 5 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: length ball angling in, and clipped to square leg. Shanto has taken off for a run but Miraz does not move. Rajitha collects the throw and takes the bails off. Now the question is - is Shanto out or Miraz? Confirmed it is Miraz because Shanto had run across to the other end, even going past the crease, while Miraz was out of his crease.

dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman lbw b Pathirana 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that's all over, Bangladesh 164 all out. Pathirana gets a slower ball to hiss through and leave Mustafizur Rahman stunned into submission. Lands on middle and leg and hits the pad with him offering almost no shot. Bangladesh review but that's a mere formality. Sri Lanka need 165 to win.

dismissalComment.html: youngster removes veteran! And Kusal Mendis has held on to a stunner too. Short ball outside off but with regulation bounce. Shakib tries to cut but ends up gloving it even before he played the shot. Keeper dives to his left and sticks the left-hand out. Then brings out a wide smile as if to say that's clean. TV umpire confirms it. Shakib clearly deceived by the extra pace, being hit on the hand even before he got the bat down for the shot

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz run out (de Silva/Rajitha) 5 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: length ball angling in, and clipped to square leg. Shanto has taken off for a run but Miraz does not move. Rajitha collects the throw and takes the bails off. Now the question is - is Shanto out or Miraz? Confirmed it is Miraz because Shanto had run across to the other end, even going past the crease, while Miraz was out of his crease.

videos.title: Watch - Mehidy Hasan Miraz run-out after mix-up with Shanto
videos.seoTitle: Watch Mehidy Hasan Miraz run out after mix up with Shanto
videos.summary: There was confusion as to which batter was out before the third umpire give his decision

dismissalText.commentary: Mahedi Hasan lbw b Wellalage 6 (16b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: full ball on middle. Gets forward to fend. Hits the pad with Mahedi defending forward. LBW appeal and given out! Mahedi is reviewing. Did that straighten enough or is that sliding down leg? Juuust clipping the outside of leg stump, enough for Sri Lanka to keep that wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman lbw b Pathirana 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that's all over, Bangladesh 164 all out. Pathirana gets a slower ball to hiss through and leave Mustafizur Rahman stunned into submission. Lands on middle and leg and hits the pad with him offering almost no shot. Bangladesh review but that's a mere formality. Sri Lanka need 165 to win.

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (21b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 23.8

dismissalComment.html: Goes through the gate! Big wicket and it's the skipper that provides it. This one is tossed up on a good length and goes on with the arm. Mendis plays for the turn that isn't there and this sneaks through bat and pad to clatter into off

dismissalText.long: st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahedi Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Sadeera Samarawickrama st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahedi Hasan 54 (77b 6x4 0x6 115m) SR: 70.12

dismissalComment.html: turn, and stumped! Full on off. Sadeera comes down the track to get to the pitch of the ball. But it turns away oh so slightly, past the outside edge, and he was way out. The keeper's fumble made no difference. Out after a well constructed 54.

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (7b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: he's yorked himself and that's Sri Lanka five down! Shakib has bowled a full delivery and de Silva is caught in no position after taking a couple of steps down the track. Finds air in his wild off-side attempt, and then turns to see middle stump rattled
